abstract: The ruling dismissing an appeal of a $79.5 million award to a smoker’s widow likely signals the end of a 10-year legal fight over the large payout.
snippet: The ruling dismissing an appeal of a $79.5 million award to a smoker’s widow likely signals the end of a 10-year legal fight over the large payout.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  A challenge to a $79.5 million punitive damages award against Philip Morris USA ended with a whimper on Tuesday when the Supreme Court announced that it should not have agreed to hear the case after all.

headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Withdraws in Tobacco Damages Case
